metadata.synopsis: Bex is hanging out by the bridge outside the Last Light alone. She's trying to get a few moments to herself to mourn, convinced that her boyfriend Danis is dead. The player can offer to help or alternatively blame her for how things unfolded (thus souring any future interactions).
metadata.how_to_trigger: Go to Haven -> Use debug book -> Act 2 setup -> Tiefling path (Go through the main entrance gate and down the path on your right - Bex is just through the bridge)

0.speaker: Bex
0.text: Danis still hasn't come back. None of them have.
0.context: NodeContext: Utterly crushed as her worst fears are confirmed

5.speaker: Player
5.text: I tried my best, but nobody else made it - I'm sorry.

41.speaker: Bex
41.context: NodeContext: Crumbling as the wave of sadness hits her

10.speaker: Bex
10.context: NodeContext: In a state of shock and grief following Danis' death; tearful

18.speaker: Bex
18.text: Danis didn't make it back, did he?
18.context: NodeContext: Utterly crushed as her worst fears are confirmed

11.speaker: Player
11.text: I'm sorry - we got out as many as we could.

1.speaker: Bex
1.text: I know. And I know it was only thanks to you that we made it out of the Grove in the first place.
1.context: NodeContext: Trying to be gracious and hold it together (not very well)

19.speaker: Bex
19.text: We were going to open a teahouse together in Baldur's Gate.

27.speaker: Bex
27.text: I was going to ask him to marry me!

67.speaker: Bex
67.text: I don't know what to do now.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: The Towers are a terrible place. We're lucky anyone made it out alive.

57.speaker: Bex
57.context: NodeContext: Trying to hold it together

34.speaker: Player
34.text: To be fair, he's probably better off dead than abandoned in Moonrise Towers.

24.speaker: Bex
24.text: Please, I just want to be alone.
24.context: NodeContext: Bex bites back tears after being interrupted

43.speaker: Player
43.text: You ought to be careful - there are dangerous people about.
43.context: InternalNodeContext: State after repelling the attack of the Flaming Fist traitor. NPCs are afraid of other possible attacks.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: I remember you - Bex, right? Where's your man?

3.speaker: Bex
3.context: NodeContext: A stab of despair, almost a wail

39.speaker: Bex
39.text: Cultists... It was so dark I didn't realise until the children started screaming.
39.context: NodeContext: Trying not to cry again as she starts to explain

29.speaker: Bex
29.text: They rounded us up... cut us up... Said they were taking whoever could still walk to Moonrise Towers.
29.context: NodeContext: Getting increasingly distressed and closer to tears

2.speaker: Bex
2.text: I managed to get away, but my love Danis... Mar zindur vroshan.
2.context: NodeContext: Voice cracking on the final sentence - proununciation of infernal "Mar zinDOOR vroSHAN" meaning "may he rest in peace".

51.speaker: Player
51.text: How did you manage to get away?

44.speaker: Bex
44.text: I've always been good at running - unlike Danis.
44.context: NodeContext: The vaguest note of humour on "unlike Danis"

62.speaker: Bex
62.text: I didn't realise one day our lives would depend on it.

56.speaker: Bex
56.text: If they didn't kill him when we ran, they probably will once they get to Moonrise.
56.context: NodeContext: Slight bitterness through the sadness

37.speaker: Player
37.text: It sounds like he meant a lot to you.

20.speaker: Bex
20.text: I just wish I could have said goodbye.
20.context: NodeContext: Can clearly feel herself about to start crying again

54.speaker: Player
54.text: Is there anything I can do to help?

33.speaker: Bex
33.text: Not unless you can bring him back.
33.context: NodeContext: Resigned, almost a little annoyed at the player for asking such a stupid question through her sadness

38.speaker: Bex
38.context: NodeContext: Slightly stand-offish through the sadness - but still a tentative glimmer of hope

47.speaker: Player
47.text: Danis could still be alive - don't give up on him yet.

36.speaker: Bex
36.text: Do you really think so? By the gods, I hope you're right.
36.context: NodeContext: Tentatively hopeful through her sadness

28.speaker: Bex
28.text: I wish I hadn't let go of him.
28.context: NodeContext: Voice cracking; she thinks it's her fault

23.speaker: Player
23.text: I'll find Danis and bring him back to you.

8.speaker: Bex
8.text: It's hard to imagine him making it after everything that happened, but if you find him...
8.context: NodeContext: Tentatively hopefuly (but still sniffly from tears)

66.speaker: Bex
66.text: It would mean the world to me.
66.context: NodeContext: Sincere, voice trembling as if she's about to start crying again

68.speaker: Player
68.text: I'll do my best to find him, but I can't promise anything.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: He is still locked in a cultist's tower - he might be better off dead.

63.speaker: Bex
63.text: I know what you're saying is true, but...
63.context: NodeContext: Clearly starting to tear up again

42.speaker: Bex
42.text: Please. I don't want to think about it.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: By the gods, I promise you I'll bring Danis back safely.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: From what I've heard, they've probably killed and eaten him. In that order, if he's lucky.

65.speaker: Bex
65.context: NodeContext: Surprise and anger momentarily cuts through her sadness

4.speaker: Player
4.text: Sounds like your boy toy's goblin chow.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: So what you're saying is you saved yourself and left your soulmate to die?

49.speaker: Bex
49.text: Really? Fine, fine. I'm Bex - I was travelling to Baldur's Gate.
49.context: NodeContext: Trying to pull herself together to explain after being interrupted mid-cry

61.speaker: Player
61.text: Stop snivelling and tell me what's wrong, then.

48.speaker: Bex
48.context: NodeContext: Attempting to gather herself to explain

26.speaker: Bex
26.text: Stay alive a little longer, and we may all find ourselves en route to the city. Would you believe it?

30.speaker: Bex
30.text: I wish I hadn't left him behind.

35.speaker: Bex
35.text: Oh - you! I almost didn't recognise you. Glad you made it. But I don't know how much longer we'll be here. Something's... happening.

58.speaker: Bex
58.text: Thank you for bringing Danis back to me - I really don't know what I'd do without him.
58.context: NodeContext: Emotionally exhausted but sincerely grateful

64.speaker: Bex
64.text: You're still going to kill that madman, aren't you? There's enough evil to go around without him.
